newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian PM meets De Benedetti to discuss Olivetti.
newsitem.headline: Italian PM meets De Benedetti to discuss Olivetti.

text.p: Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi met former Olivetti chairman Carlo De Benedetti on Tuesday to discuss the situation at the troubled information and technology group.
"I called him in to find out directly about the situation at Olivetti," Prodi told reporters after the meeting.
De Benedetti stepped down as chairman last week after failing to meet a promise to stem losses at the company.

Olivetti said it made a first half pre-tax loss of 440.8 billion lire ($291.7 million), but the results have been questioned by former director general Renzo Francesconi, who also resigned from the firm last week.
Olivetti shares fell almost 20 percent on Monday and were down another three percent at 586 lire at 1400 GMT on Tuesday.
